newsitem.title: USA: FCOJ futures close up in breather from selloff.
newsitem.headline: FCOJ futures close up in breather from selloff.

text.p: FCOJ futures finished higher Monday as speculative and local buying helped the market rebound from Friday's selloff, but dealings were quiet, traders said.
Most-active September settled up 1.55 cents at 75.00 cents a lb, traded 75.10 to 73.35 cents. Volume was estimated at 1,500 lots.
"We could go up to about 75.50 cents in the September contract, the 20-day moving average, but we are looking for heavy resistance there," a dealer said.
"Overall, the picture still looks lower. We are just getting a little bit of a breather after several down days," the dealer added.
Bernard Savaiko of PaineWebber said the market was acting like it was oversold.
"The cold storage report highlighted there is still a lot of juice out there, but it was down a little bit from the last report so that might be a bit constructive," Savaiko said.
After the close Friday, USDA reported that on June 30, U.S. orange juice stocks totaled 198,251 gallons, compared with 219,886 gallons on May 31.
